page.title: 02TOPOGRAPHY
page.content: The area consists of undulating land with a hill in 05750253 rising to 330 feet asl and land falling away in all directions. There are some gentle valleys with streams. Towards the NW corner, in COWLINGE, there is the spur of another hill on which the village of Cowlinge is sited. In the SW corner the land rises towards Barnardiston and reaches the giddy heights of 375 feet asl. (NOTE At the extreme SW corner this HIGH POINT gives its name to H M Prison ) The stream which rises near W'brook Church is the beginning of R GLEM which is a tributary of the R STOUR.
